title: Incremental outline updates with merge strategies
description:
## Description
Update outlines incrementally instead of full regeneration, detect which sections of outline need updating, preserve manually edited sections of outline, merge strategy for outline conflicts, and partial regeneration of documents.

## Functionality
- `doc-gen update-outline <doc-path>` for incremental updates
- Diff existing outline with new source analysis
- Preserve manual edits with conflict markers
- `--sections` flag to update specific sections only
- Merge manual edits with LLM-generated updates

## Why Deferred
MVP regenerates outlines completely when sources change. This is simpler and sufficient for initial validation. Incremental updates are optimization for established workflows.

## Reconsider When
- Outline regeneration becomes too slow
- Users frequently hand-edit outlines
- Merge conflicts become common pain point
- Partial updates are clearly needed

## Effort Estimate
2 weeks

title: Plugin system for custom doc generators
description:
## Description
Plugin architecture for custom doc generators with hook system for pre/post processing, custom outline formats, custom LLM providers, and community plugin marketplace.

## Why Deferred
MVP uses built-in generation logic. Plugins add architectural complexity before validating core value. Better to learn patterns before enabling customization.

## Reconsider When
- Users need custom generation logic
- Multiple doc types require different approaches
- Community wants to extend functionality
- Plugin ecosystem would add value

## Effort Estimate
3-4 weeks

title: Add unit tests for document generation
description:
## Description
Document generation module (generation.py) was implemented without comprehensive unit tests. This was a pragmatic tradeoff to deliver Sprint 3 quickly, but tests should be added for maintainability and reliability.

## Context
This is technical debt from Sprint 3 (Document Generation). The module is functional and working, but lacks proper test coverage which increases risk for future changes.

## Scope
- Unit tests for DocumentGenerator class
- Tests for prompt construction logic
- Markdown validation tests
- Frontmatter generation tests
- File extraction tests
- Integration test for full document generation flow

## Acceptance Criteria
- >80% test coverage for generation.py
- All DocumentGenerator methods have unit tests
- Integration test covers full document generation flow
- Tests are well-documented and maintainable
- CI/CD pipeline runs tests successfully

## Effort Estimate
4-6 hours

## Sprint Assignment
Sprint 4 or later (technical debt cleanup)

## Origin
Sprint 3 (Document Generation) - completed 2025-12-12

title: Multi-language documentation generation and localization
description:
## Description
Generate docs in multiple languages with translation memory for consistency, language-specific templates, and localization workflow.

## Why Deferred
Out of scope for MVP - single language (English) is sufficient. Translation is separate concern.

## Reconsider When
- Multiple language requirements emerge
- International users request localized docs
- Translation becomes bottleneck

## Effort Estimate
3-4 weeks

title: GitHub Actions automation for scheduled doc regeneration
description:
## Description
Scheduled workflow to check changes daily/weekly, auto-regenerate and create PRs with updated docs, post-commit hooks to detect changes on push, notification system (Slack, email) when docs are stale, and integration with CI/CD for automated validation.

## Functionality
- `.github/workflows/doc-gen-check.yml` for scheduled checks
- `doc-gen check-changes --ci` mode with machine-readable output
- `doc-gen regenerate-changed --create-pr` to auto-create PRs
- Status badges showing doc freshness
- Webhook integration for external triggers

## Why Deferred
MVP is CLI-first. Automation requires stable core system first. Users can manually run commands until automation is needed. Premature automation adds complexity.

## Reconsider When
- MVP proves valuable and users want automation
- Manual regeneration becomes tedious
- Team wants scheduled doc updates without manual intervention
- Multiple contributors need automated doc validation

## Effort Estimate
1 week

title: Evaluation harness for prompt testing
description:
## Description
Test prompt variations against known-good documentation examples with automated quality scoring, A/B comparison of prompt strategies, regression detection when prompts change, and metrics dashboard for prompt performance.

## Functionality
- Define evaluation datasets (source files → expected doc qualities)
- Run generation with multiple prompt variants
- Score outputs automatically (embedding similarity, structure validation)
- Compare results side-by-side
- Track prompt performance over time

## Why Deferred
MVP focuses on getting core pipeline working. Prompt optimization requires the system to exist first. Current approach is manual review of generated docs.

## Reconsider When
- MVP ships and users report quality issues
- Need to iterate on prompts systematically
- Multiple doc types require different prompt strategies
- Users request better control over generation quality

## Effort Estimate
1-2 weeks

title: Improve document generation prompt strategy
description:
## Description
Current outline → document generation strategy uses basic prompts. Quality is acceptable for MVP but could be improved with better prompt engineering. Debug logs are now available for iteration and improvement.

## Current Approach
- Single LLM call with full outline + all mentioned source files
- Basic system prompt + structured user prompt
- Section-level prompts from outline guide content generation
- Currently truncates large source files at 8000 chars

## Potential Improvements
- Iterative section-by-section generation for better context management
- Better use of section "prompt" fields from outlines
- Improved examples in system prompt for better output quality
- Better handling of code examples and snippets
- Chunk large source files more intelligently (avoid truncation)

## How to Investigate
Use debug mode to view current prompts and identify improvement opportunities:
```bash
doc-gen --debug generate-doc docs/test-example.md
```

Review generated prompts and LLM responses to identify patterns and areas for enhancement.

## Acceptance Criteria
- Improved document quality (subjective but measurable through user feedback)
- Better handling of large source files (no truncation)
- More intelligent section generation
- Debug logs demonstrate improved prompt structure
- Documentation updated with prompt engineering insights

## Effort Estimate
1-2 weeks (iterative improvement process)

## Sprint Assignment
Post-MVP or when quality issues are reported

## Origin
Sprint 3 (Document Generation) - improvement identified during cleanup

title: Smart change detection with significance filtering
description:
## Description
Detect significant changes (not just any commit) with line count thresholds (e.g., only regenerate if >10% lines changed), file type filtering (ignore README changes, focus on code), semantic analysis (did the API actually change?), and confidence scoring for "how stale is this doc?".

## Functionality
- Configure change thresholds in config.yaml
- `check-changes --smart` flag for filtered detection
- Report change significance scores
- `regenerate-changed --threshold=0.7` to regenerate only high-confidence stale docs
- Explain why regeneration is recommended

## Why Deferred
MVP uses simple commit hash comparison - regenerate if ANY tracked file changed. This is sufficient to prove the concept. Smart detection requires tuning and may over-complicate initial release.

## Reconsider When
- Users complain about too many false positive regenerations
- Source repos have frequent non-meaningful commits
- Regeneration costs become significant (too many LLM calls)
- Users want more control over when to regenerate

## Effort Estimate
1-2 weeks

title: Automated documentation quality metrics and scoring
description:
## Description
Automated quality scoring for generated docs with metrics tracking completeness, clarity, accuracy, formatting, trend tracking over time, and alerts when quality degrades.

## Why Deferred
Quality is initially validated by human review. Automated metrics require ML models or extensive heuristics. Premature optimization.

## Reconsider When
- Quality issues emerge systematically
- Need to track doc quality at scale
- Automated alerts would prevent issues

## Effort Estimate
2-3 weeks

title: Support for non-Git sources (local, API, archives)
description:
## Description
Support non-Git sources including local directories, archives, URLs, documentation systems (Confluence, Notion), API endpoints (OpenAPI specs), mixed-source docs (Git + API + local files), and source plugins for extensibility.

## Functionality
- `source_type: local` in sources.yaml for local directories
- `source_type: url` for direct file downloads
- `source_type: api` for structured API sources
- Plugin system for custom source types
- Unified interface regardless of source type

## Why Deferred
MVP focuses on Git repositories (the stated problem domain). Supporting other sources adds complexity without validating core value. Git sources cover 95% of use cases.

## Reconsider When
- Users need to source from non-Git systems
- Documentation spans multiple source types
- Integration with other systems becomes common
- Plugin ecosystem emerges

## Effort Estimate
2-3 weeks

title: Version-specific documentation for multiple code versions
description:
## Description
Generate docs for multiple code versions with version selector in documentation, diff docs between versions, and track breaking changes across versions.

## Why Deferred
MVP generates current-version docs. Version management is complex and not needed for initial validation.

## Reconsider When
- Need to maintain docs for multiple versions
- Breaking changes require version-specific docs
- Users request historical documentation

## Effort Estimate
2-3 weeks

title: Template system for customizable doc structure
description:
## Description
Define custom templates for doc structure with per-doc-type templates (API docs, guides, tutorials), template variables and sections, conditional content based on source characteristics, and template inheritance and composition.

## Functionality
- `templates/` directory with Jinja2 templates
- `sources.yaml` specifies template: `template: api-reference`
- Template variables populated from outline
- Conditional sections (e.g., "Examples" only if examples exist)
- Override templates per doc or globally

## Why Deferred
MVP generates freeform markdown based on LLM prompts. Templates add structure but limit flexibility. Better to learn what structure works before codifying templates.

## Reconsider When
- Generated docs have inconsistent structure
- Multiple doc types need different formats
- Users want more control over doc structure
- Certain sections should always be present/absent

## Effort Estimate
2 weeks

title: Interactive TUI for editing sources.yaml
description:
## Description
TUI (Terminal UI) for editing sources.yaml with visual file browser to select includes/excludes, real-time validation as you edit, repository preview (show matched files before saving), and templates for common source patterns.

## Functionality
- `doc-gen edit-sources <doc-path>` opens TUI
- Browse repository file tree interactively
- Toggle include/exclude patterns visually
- Live preview of matched files
- Save and validate in one step
- Common patterns library (e.g., "all Python files", "API docs only")

## Why Deferred
MVP uses manual YAML editing which is sufficient for power users. Interactive editor is nice-to-have but adds significant complexity. YAML is hand-editable and version-controllable.

## Reconsider When
- Non-technical users need to define sources
- Common errors emerge from manual YAML editing
- Users request "easier way to specify sources"
- Pattern selection becomes tedious

## Effort Estimate
2 weeks

title: AI-powered change summarization and impact analysis
description:
## Description
LLM summarizes what changed in sources with natural language explanation of changes, impact analysis (breaking changes, new features, etc.), and automated changelog generation.

## Why Deferred
MVP focuses on detection and regeneration. Change summarization is nice-to-have for communication but not essential for core workflow.

## Reconsider When
- Need to communicate changes to stakeholders
- Changelog generation becomes tedious
- Impact analysis would improve decision-making

## Effort Estimate
1-2 weeks

title: Advanced batch operations beyond regenerate-changed
description:
## Description
Batch operations including `doc-gen regenerate-all` (force regenerate everything), `doc-gen regenerate-pattern "modules/*"` (regenerate by path pattern), `doc-gen validate-all` (validate all source specs), `doc-gen promote-all` (bulk promotion of reviewed docs), and parallel execution for faster batch operations.

## Functionality
- Glob pattern matching for selective operations
- `--parallel` flag for concurrent execution
- Progress bars for long-running operations
- Dry-run modes (`--dry-run`) to preview actions
- Logging and error handling for batch failures

## Why Deferred
MVP focuses on per-doc operations and simple orchestration. Batch operations are convenient but not essential for initial validation. Users can script their own batch operations if needed.

## Reconsider When
- Users manage 50+ docs and need bulk operations
- Manual iteration over docs becomes tedious
- Performance becomes an issue (need parallelization)
- Common patterns emerge for batch workflows

## Effort Estimate
1 week

title: Web UI for visual doc review and promotion
description:
## Description
Local web server for reviewing docs visually with side-by-side diff viewer, markdown preview with styling, one-click promotion from browser, and batch review interface for multiple docs.

## Functionality
- `doc-gen serve-review` starts local web server
- Navigate all docs with staging changes
- Visual diff highlighting
- Promote/reject buttons per doc
- Comments/notes on reviewed docs
- Export review decisions as audit log

## Why Deferred
CLI-based review (`doc-gen review`) with diff output is sufficient for MVP. Web UI is more user-friendly but adds significant development overhead. Terminal users are comfortable with CLI diffs.

## Reconsider When
- Non-technical reviewers need to approve docs
- Team wants centralized review workflow
- Visual diff becomes essential (complex formatting)
- Multiple reviewers need coordination

## Effort Estimate
2-3 weeks
